comments:
In the debug Display view, typed "content.toString()" (where "content" is a
byte[]) selected it and pressed "Inspect Result" toolbar button.  The following
 message was printed in the Display window:

   Evaluation failed. Reason(s):
      An exception occurred in the evaluation engine. See log for details.

This was in the .log file:
--------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 120 Dec 31, 2002 00:00:54.109
!MESSAGE Internal error logged from JDI Debug: 
!STACK 0
java.lang.ClassCastException
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIObjectValue.sendMessage(JDIObjectValue.java:96)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.instructions.SendMessage.execute(SendMessage.java:51)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.Interpreter.execute(Interpreter.java:44)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.EvaluationThread$1$EvaluationRunnable.run(EvaluationThread.java:159)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread.runEvaluation(JDIThread.java:559)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.EvaluationThread.doEvaluation(EvaluationThread.java:181)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.EvaluationThread.access$2(EvaluationThread.java:143)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.eval.ast.engine.EvaluationThread$1.run(EvaluationThread.java:117)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)

Fixed.
The java model and the JDI client didn't managed the fact that a method can be
call on an array object.
Changes in JDIObjectValue and ObjectReferenceImpl.

I filled a bug report against j9, as the invocation of the method generate an
error (internal OTI bug report 94672).
Works fine on IBM and Sun VMs.
